tn.text: This introduces a new event that happened a while later. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_newevent]])

tn.ref: the anger of King Ahasuerus subsided
tn.text: "the king became less angry"
This is refers to the decree in [[:en:bible:notes:est:01:19|1:19-20]].
This can be stated in active form. AT: "Tell your servants to search" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The men speak to the king in the third person as a sign of respect. AT: "on your behalf" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
The  young servants continue to speak to the king.

tn.ref: Let the king ... the king's official ... pleases the king
tn.text: The servants spoke to the king in third person as a sign of respect. AT: "You should ... your official ... pleases you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:est:01:01|1:1]].
"place where a ruler's wives are kept" (UDB)
Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:est:01:05|1:5]].
Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:est:01:01|1:2]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Let them be put under the care of Hegai, the king's official, who is in charge of the women
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Let Hegai, the king's official, who is in charge of the women, take care of them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is a man's name. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
A "cosmetic" is a substance such as a cream, lotion, or powder that women usually put on their face or body to improve their appearance.
This introduces Mordecai as a new character in the story. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_participants]])
Translate the name of this city as in [[:en:bible:notes:est:01:01|1:2]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: son of Jair son of Shimei son of Kish
tn.text: "Jair," "Shimei," and "Kish" are men from whom "Mordecai" is the male descendant. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"of the tribe of Benjamin" (UDB)

tn.ref: He had been taken away ... king of Babylonia carried away
tn.text: This background information explains how Mordecai came to live in Susa. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylonia carried him and other exiles away along with Jehoiachin, king of Judah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: He had been taken away from Jerusalem
tn.text: The Hebrew text leaves unclear who is being spoken of here. It is perhaps Kish, who seems to have been the great-grandfather of Mordecai. If it was Mordecai himself, then he would be extremely old at the time of the events concerning Esther. Many modern versions leave this matter unclear. A few versions, including the UDB, choose to assume that it was Mordecai who had been taken away from Jerusalem.
(See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This continues the background information about Mordecai and explains his relationship to Esther. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
This is Esther's Hebrew name. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"his cousin" (UDB)

tn.ref: she had neither father nor mother
tn.text: "her father and mother had died"

tn.ref: took her as his own daughter
tn.text: "cared for her as if she was his own daughter"

tn.ref: When the king's order and decree were proclaimed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "After the king commanded that they search for some beautiful women" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"announced"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "they brought many young women" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:est:01:05|1:5]].

tn.ref: They were put under Hegai's care
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Hegai began to take care of them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Esther also was taken into the king's palace and put under the care of Hegai, the overseer of the women
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Hegai, the overseer of the women, also began to take care of Esther when they brought her to the king's palace" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: The young girl pleased him, and she found favor with him
tn.text: These two phrases mean the same thing and emphasize how much she pleased him. AT: "The young girl greatly pleased him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
"Esther"
"how Esther was doing" or "about Esther's well-being"
Verses 12-14 are background information about the customs for the women who became the king's wives. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])

tn.ref: complying with the regulations for the women
tn.text: "acting in accordance with the requirements for the women"
Things done to make the girls look more beautiful and smell good.
Use the same word or phrase used in [[:en:bible:notes:est:02:03|2:3]].

tn.ref: whatever she desired was given to her
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "she could take whatever she desired" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:est:01:05|1:5]].

This continues the background information that began in [[:en:bible:notes:est:02:12|2:12]] about the customs for the women who became the king's wives. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
It is implied that this is the following morning. This information can be made clear. AT: "the next morning" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"a different house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"supervision" or "protection" (UDB)
This is a man's name. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This introduces a new part of the story. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_newevent]])

tn.ref: daughter of Abihail, the uncle of Mordecai, who had taken her as his own daughter
tn.text: This background information reminds the reader of Esther's relationship to Mordecai. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_newevent]])
"Abihail" was Esther's father and Mordecai's uncle. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: she did not ask for anything but what
tn.text: This can be stated in positive form. "she asked only for what"
Translate this man's name as in [[:en:bible:notes:est:02:03|2:3]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is an idiom. AT: "pleased all" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: the tenth month, which is the month of Tebeth
tn.text: "Tebeth" is the name of the tenth month of the Hebrew calendar. It is during the last part December and the first part January on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"year number 7" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
This is the romantic use of the word "love."

tn.ref: received acceptance and favor before him
tn.text: These idioms mean the same thing and emphasize how much the Esther pleased the king. AT: "greatly pleased him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: set the royal crown on her head
tn.text: The king did this to show that he was making her his queen. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
It may be helpful to state that this is the name of the feast. AT: "he called it, "Esther's feast," (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"the collection of taxes"
Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:est:01:01|1:1]].
"generosity that only a king can give" (UDB)

tn.ref: when the virgins had been gathered together a second time
tn.text: It is unclear when this second gathering happened, and why. Therefore some versions have altered the text somewhat. It is probably best to translate it as it is written.
"one more time" or "an additional time" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: Mordecai was sitting at the king's gate
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) Mordecai sat there so he could hear how Esther was doing from the many people who passed through the gate or 2) "sitting at the king's gate" is an idiom that means Mordecai was given a position of authority by the king.
"the gate to the king's palace"
Mordecai told her not to tell anyone about her family.
This introduces a new event in the story. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_newevent]])
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: When the matter was revealed to Mordecai
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "When Mordecai learned about what they were planning" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is an idiom. AT: "on behalf of Mordecai" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: The report was investigated and confirmed, and both the men were hanged
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The king investigated and confirmed the report, and ordered his servants to hang both men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

This was a structure used for killing people by tying one end of a rope around the top of the structure and the other end of the rope around their necks and hanging them from it. AT: "a frame for hanging people"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "They recorded this account" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
